cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles WNW of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW across Hispaniola, forecast to skirt Cuba, then turn northwestward into the Gulf of Mexico and toward the Louisiana coast as a strengthening hurricane
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (likely south-central to south-west LA, west of Plaquemines Parish)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for the U.S. coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for the U.S. coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire north-central Gulf Coast from Texas to Mississippi, including southeast Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph, higher gusts) possible late Tuesday night through Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 3–5 ft surge along exposed portions of Plaquemines Parish facing the Gulf and lower Mississippi River
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands Wednesday could produce 4–8 inches with locally higher totals causing flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands; hazardous seas affecting navigation well ahead of the center
